title: Science website: Blue light effects on circadian rhythm (with author credits)

requirements.text: Create a responsive, science-focused informational website that explains the effects of blue light on circadian rhythm, written in clear English for a general audience.

quotes:
Create a website about science for effects of blue light on circadian rhythm by PushpakSaha
Md. Zawraiz Khan

acceptanceCriteria: The site loads without errors and renders correctly on mobile and desktop screen sizes.
All user-facing text is in English and focuses on the science of blue light and circadian rhythm.

requirements.text: Include structured content sections covering: (1) what blue light is (wavelength range and common sources), (2) how circadian rhythm and melatonin work at a high level, (3) mechanisms of blue light impact (ipRGCs/melanopsin and alerting effects), (4) evidence summary (what research generally shows and typical findings), (5) practical mitigation strategies (evening lighting, screen settings, timing, environment), and (6) cautions/limitations (individual differences, brightness/duration, not medical advice).

quotes: Create a website about science for effects of blue light on circadian rhythm

acceptanceCriteria: All six content areas are present as clearly labeled sections on the site.
The content includes at least one short explanation of the biological pathway linking blue light exposure to melatonin/circadian phase effects.
A limitations/disclaimer section is present and clearly visible.

requirements.text: Add a clear author/credit area that attributes the site to both names exactly as provided: "PushpakSaha" and "Md. Zawraiz Khan".
acceptanceCriteria: The rendered site visibly credits both "PushpakSaha" and "Md. Zawraiz Khan" (spelled exactly) in a consistent location (e.g., footer and/or About section).

requirements.text: Implement basic site navigation for a single-page experience (scroll-to sections) or a small set of routes (e.g., Home, Science, Tips, References/About), ensuring users can quickly reach each major section.

quotes: Create a website about science for effects of blue light on circadian rhythm

acceptanceCriteria: Users can access each major section from a top navigation element.
Navigation works without full page reload errors.

requirements.text: Add a references section with a short, readable bibliography-style list of credible sources (e.g., review articles, academic/medical institutions). Do not claim or fabricate specific study outcomes beyond the high-level summary presented on the page.

quotes: website about science for effects of blue light on circadian rhythm

acceptanceCriteria: A "References" (or equivalent) section exists and contains multiple credible sources.
The site avoids presenting overly specific numerical claims without citation context.

requirements.text: Choose and apply a coherent visual theme suitable for a science education website (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styles) and enforce it consistently across all pages/sections. Avoid defaulting to a blue/purple theme.

quotes: Create a website about science for effects of blue light on circadian rhythm

acceptanceCriteria: The UI has a consistent, intentional visual style across navigation, headings, body text, and callouts.
The primary theme is not a generic blue/purple gradient look.

requirements.text: Generate and include static visual assets to support the educational content, stored under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the relevant sections of the site (do not serve images via the backend).

quotes: Create a website about science for effects of blue light on circadian rhythm

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated and are displayed on the site.
No backend endpoints are used to fetch or proxy these images.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose them instead.
nonGoals: User accounts, comments, or content editing/admin features.
Integrations with external databases or third-party APIs.

required: Wide hero illustration showing a stylized human head silhouette with a moon/sleep motif and a screen emitting light (hero-blue-light.dim_1600x700.png)
Simple infographic illustration showing the pathway from light exposure to brain signaling and melatonin suppression (melatonin-pathway-infographic.dim_1400x900.png)
Set of three minimal line icons: screen, light bulb, crescent moon (blue-light-icons-set.dim_512x512.png)
